page.title: 14THE BERWYN CENTRE
page.content: THE WORKMEN'S HALL WAS BUILT IN NANTYMOEL IN 1901 WITH SUBSCRIPTIONS BY THE WORKMEN. IT CATERED FOR MINERS AND THEIR FAMILIES IN EVERY FORM OF SOCIAL ACTIVITY. IN 1931 THERE WAS THE OPENING OF THE "TALKIES", WHICH BECAME THE NEW MAIN SOURCE OF ENTERTAINMENT FOR TWENTY YEARS. LATER, IN 1952, IT WAS CHANGED TO THE BERWYN CENTRE, WITH ALTERATIONS INSIDE AND OUT. THERE WAS A WORKMAN'S ACCIDENT FUND MADE UP TO PAY FOR THIS BUILDING. WHEN ALTERATIONS FINALLY ENDED, THE COMMITEE THROUGH OUT THE YEARS AND IN LATER DAYS, ALSO LOOKED AFTER THE CULTURAL SIDE, WITH AN EXTENSIVE LIBRARY, READING ROOMS, DRAMA WEEKS, AND ART COUNCIL PLAYS. THE BERWYN CENTRE STILL PLAYS A MAJOR PART IN THE COMMUNITY LIFE OF THE OGMORE VALLEY.
